_header: Alas deceit that in trust is now
Subjects: deceit, on; evils of the times

BodLauMis108.Transcription:
[A]llas diceyte þat in truste ys nowe[ ]uble as fortune turnyng
                    as a balle[ ]etylle at assay lyke þe rotyn boweWho trustith to
                    trust is redy for to falle[ ]uche gyle ys in trust all most ouer alle[
                    ]at yn poynte a man no frende fynde shalleÞerfore be ware of trust
                    after my devise[T]rust to þi selfe and lerne to be wyse
BodLauMis108.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 100.
Davies,  Reginald Thorne. 
             Medieval English Lyrics: a critical anthology.
         London, 1963; Evanston, IL: Northwestern UP, 1964: 161.
